cells.4d07701c-4db3-46af-b479-a3a057758a9c: Unique identifier for the enemy archetype. Used as the lookup key across all spawn and combat systems.
The game level at which this enemy type reaches maximum spawn frequency. Before this level, spawn rate ramps up; after it, spawn rate decays based on Falloff.
Controls how wide the spawn probability bell curve is around PeakLevel. Higher values mean the enemy appears across a broader range of levels. Lower values concentrate spawns tightly around the peak.
Rate at which spawn probability drops after passing PeakLevel. Higher falloff means the enemy disappears faster from the pool in late game. Used to cycle enemy variety over progression.
Base spawn weight before level-based modifiers are applied. Higher weight means this enemy is more likely to be selected when multiple types are eligible. Acts as a global frequency knob.
Difficulty rating used by the wave budget system. Each wave has a total difficulty budget — higher difficulty enemies consume more budget, resulting in fewer spawns per wave but tougher encounters.
Per-enemy spawn curve data. Each row in the subtable defines a data point for the spawn probability distribution across levels. Used by the wave spawner to sample spawn rates at any given level.
